08095A41BC884EBBB0E7B08B567B7037.description: The concept of quality and its importance in: • the production of goods and the provision of services: o quality control o total quality management (TQM) • allowing a business to gain a competitive advantage

1CC6D5D304F94885B9722FB87F47A6AE.description: Changing relationships between enterprise, capital, land, and labour: • difference between capital-intensive and labour-intensive activities.

AA1ABFC367B54ADA8730A7E78D272471.description: Impact of technology in production: • use of robotics • balancing cost, productivity, quality and flexibility.

4754386579314D33812CB3E5F8D8E8E6.description: Principles of lean production: • just-in-time (JIT) • Kaizen • the importance of using resources effectively.

13FFAB9514C240A1BA2AF10B68A130BD.description: Production processes: • different types: o job o batch o flow • labour and capital intensive production • the impact of different types of production • calculation of productivity and the impact of productivity improvements.

8C7998B87CAA47B4AA502019AF79850F.description: Diseconomies of scale: • limits of growth.

322949934FC540BDB199FFD68B8F4150.description: Economies of scale: • internal (falling average total costs as output increases) • external (falling average total costs due to external factors).

8FD82FCF08E041F9AA9774AF499D2AE9.description:
Promotion: • promotion strategies for different market segments: o advertising o sponsorship o product trials o special offers o branding • above the line and below the line promotion techniques • public relations – improving company image/brand
the use of technology in promotion:
o targeted advertising online
o viral advertising via social media
o e-newsletters
• the importance of a brand.

B192E7D6AD6842E9B721490218E20C1C.description: Place – distribution channels: • methods of distribution o retailers o e-tailers (e-commerce).

9A69EC5F7AE241439E6F5CFBF6B85C11.description: Price: • the main pricing strategies and when they might be applied: o cost plus o penetration o competition o skimming o promotional

99EF606A0AC64A2D9D884CB86B2C23A8.description: Product: • development of a new product/service • the difference between goods and services • packaging and its importance • product life cycle – main phases and extension strategies • managing and reviewing the product portfolio (Boston matrix).

312EC18069044C1082341EA6C0907722.description: How businesses use market segmentation to target customers: • identifying market segments: o location o demographics o lifestyle o income o age.

24550DF12E284C4786FB6EA5CA00A2A0.description: Responding to changes in the market: • changing customer needs • changing customer/consumer spending patterns • increased competition.

F8D6645CEB0F4DE680BF28B2B52032A6.description: Importance of marketing: • satisfying customer needs • building customer relationships • keeping customer loyalty • market orientation and product orientation • market share and analysis • niche and mass marketing.

F2BF07001C714373B2A096DE5C6D24FC.description: The use of data in market research: • qualitative and quantitative data • the role of social media in collecting market research data • the importance of the reliability of market research data.

B33B0D372B5C4E5898B92FA0B113B16B.description: Methods of market research: • primary research: o survey o questionnaire o focus group o observation o test marketing • secondary research: o internet o market reports o government reports.

C5D19C69C45242F6BAE19BE91E3060A7.description: The purpose of market research: • to identify and understand customer needs • to identify gaps in the market • to reduce risk • to inform business decisions.

6734EACB411D4BD9817F90376C6DF965.description: The use of financial documents: • assess the performance of the business • inform decision making.

A8F0C8F94B60413EBD298869F7F8E2C9.description: Liquidity: • the concept and importance of liquidity • comparisons with previous years and/or with other business organisations.

F87EF3691B5B42A287F31B61863994A0.description: Calculating and analysing accounting ratios: • gross profit margin • operating profit margin • markup • return on capital employed (ROCE) • current ratio • acid test ratio. (Formulae for use in this qualification can be found in Appendix 4. Students will be provided with these formulae in the examination.)

3A3AD3E061B545158BE3E25FB1601CB2.description: The purpose of statements of financial position: • main features – current and non-current assets, current and non-current liabilities, capital employed • interpret a statement of financial position (students will not be required to construct a statement of financial position).

50C8E2D09AB9497690575E5C5720C163.description: The purpose of statements of comprehensive income: • main features – sales, cost of sales, gross profit, expenses, operating profit • the use of statements of comprehensive income in decision making (students will not be required to construct an income statement) • the nature of profit and its importance.

AF6DB53B1527473F9F681A04C7B55639.description: Interpretation of break-even charts: • the impact of changes in revenue and costs • limitations of break-even charts.

6A4D67A1CA964E719B0B0FFB027C3180.description: The concept of break-even and calculation of break-even (from formula or diagram): • break-even level of output.

5AF0BE9300CC447B967580084A89C1E5.description: The concept and calculation of: • revenue • fixed and variable costs • total costs • profit and loss.

6CA6AEF51BF543FFBE9F1C05A54187D3.description: Calculation and interpretation of cash-flow forecasts: • cash inflows • cash outflows • net cash flow • opening and closing balances.

B435FB4A0C3B467DBAEAA47DB0521315.description: The importance of cash to a business: • to pay suppliers, overheads and employees • to prevent business failure (insolvency) • the difference between cash and profit.

6EABFA777B08454A84B74793DF63E3ED.description: External sources of finance: • overdraft and trade payables • loan capital, share capital, including stock market flotation (public limited companies) • venture capital • crowdfunding.

7560040E546046698BEC8D0D47DA4A43.description: Internal sources of finance: • personal savings • retained profit • selling assets.

5238579067B540EF9CD96F9D71DDB533.description: The need for finance: • short-term needs • long-term needs • to start up or expand.

E0A475D6CDD042DA987BE6B245CB3207.description: The different functional areas within a business: • human resources – workforce planning, recruitment and selection, training, health and safety, staff welfare, employment issues, industrial relations, disciplinary and grievance procedure, dismissal, unfair dismissal and redundancy • finance – wages/salaries, cash-flow forecasting, budgets and accounting • marketing – market research, product planning, pricing, sales promotion, advertising, customer service, public relations, packaging and distribution • production – manufacturing the product, designing new products, quality control and stock control.

CF803FB1AF8449CFBC958CC53A25705F.description: The different functional areas within a business: • human resources – workforce planning, recruitment and selection, training, health and safety, staff welfare, employment issues, industrial relations, disciplinary and grievance procedure, dismissal, unfair dismissal and redundancy • finance – wages/salaries, cash-flow forecasting, budgets and accounting • marketing – market research, product planning, pricing, sales promotion, advertising, customer service, public relations, packaging and distribution • production – manufacturing the product, designing new products, quality control and stock control.

96E0E25C37844F659DA941CE0897B69C.description: Roles and responsibilities of employees in terms of compliance and accountability: • span of control • chain of command • delegation.

C082333FDD874D3383C4508EE9A2A645.description: Organisational charts for different types of business: • hierarchical and flat • centralised and decentralised.

B3CA8929DB5A44C8816C672FDCE125E2.description: How businesses motivate employees: • financial methods: o remuneration o bonus o commission o promotion o fringe benefits • non-financial methods: o job rotation o job enrichment o autonomy.

EBA320DC06CC41EBBE5E5EDE0166E597.description: The importance of motivation in the workplace: • attracting employees, retaining employees, productivity • motivational theories of Herzberg, Maslow and Taylor.

29F4C34F518D440BABFCCF6F747F5A6B.description: Importance of training to a business and workers: • different types of training and the main purpose o induction o on-the-job o off-the-job • compliance with health and safety laws • benefits and limitations of training

AA797912E3DF434FAD6C591ED0CCF929.description: Legal controls over employment and their effects: • equal opportunities – gender, race, disability, religion, sexual preference, age • minimum wage law

50565D77801F44FAB93A8F3884248484.description: Internal and external recruitment: • job advertisement • shortlisting • interviewing.

27B20128D7EE4B01A6D3879B1C7E36B6.description: Recruitment documents: • job description • person specification • application form • curriculum vitae (CV)/résumé.

82F96C4FA52F4F2099760099C314D7DA.description: Types of employment: • full-time • part-time • job share • casual/seasonal/temporary.

7FA0663955454D3A8564ECDCEEBFCFDB.description: Barriers to communication: • how communication barriers arise • problems of ineffective communication and how they can be removed.

BCDE033DAA984E3B9654F28B94EE6B4C.description: Importance of good communication and the problems of ineffective communication: • the different communication methods used, including information technology (IT) and the benefits and limitations of each method.

C1A331CB82B644C98982BD63619D0DAE.description: Reasons for business failure: • cash flow problems/lack of finance • not competitive • failure to adapt to changes in the market.

B3B43A50F5CB4203AF35BD9621857FFC.description: Measuring success in business: • revenue • market share • customer satisfaction • profit • growth • owner/shareholder satisfaction • employee satisfaction.

9488B6725EF74C0EA58028DEF0F0761B.description: The external factors affecting business decisions: • social • technological • environmental • political.

CBFDF6DE170C4C96A3F7193CBCC4524D.description: The effect of interest rates on: • businesses • consumer spending.

0804D8A405734B1D82BDEA01FE113B57.description: How governments can affect business activity: • infrastructure provision • legislation • trade policy - membership of trading blocs, tariffs.

530D33E12AF546D6803246DE9BC3DBBA.description: Government spending: • to provide public service • taxation and constraints on public spending.

34F6F05B85064FD1BB33FBF16CB485C5.description: The impact of exchange rate changes: • on international competitiveness • on importers and exporters.

8DA43C074E924C7593D3078755C199FB.description: The impact of exchange rate changes: • on international competitiveness • on importers and exporters.

1D05BF10DCFF4767AAF219D706E64D83.description: The importance and growth of multinationals: • benefits of a business becoming a multinational • benefits to a country and/or economy where a multinational company is located • possible drawbacks to a country and/or economy where a multinational is located.

8872138291594018859BB2F1A5F0CA8D.description: Globalisation: • concept of globalisation • opportunities and threats of globalisation for businesses.

A4C99FA516344B2EB6F78419F68A53EE.description: The main factors influencing location decisions and relocation of a business: • proximity to market, labour, materials and competitors • nature of the business activity • the impact of the internet on location decisions - e-commerce and/or fixed premises • legal controls and trade blocs.

A60CC38EB10F48BFAAA17DFC11659FBF.description: Primary, secondary and tertiary activities: • primary sector – extracting raw materials from the earth • secondary sector – converting raw materials into finished or semi-finished goods • tertiary sector – provision of a wide variety of services.

A0A8E4676629405D9B619EAC3D454635.description: Different forms of business organisation: • franchises • social enterprises • multinationals.

D9F438C67BDF419594E64154671952AC.description: Characteristics relating to size: • concepts of risk, ownership and limited liability • public corporations – reasons for and against public ownership • ownership, control, sources of finance, use of profits, stakeholders and shareholders • appropriateness of different forms of ownership.

20AB83668551484C86F6385AB0386754.description: The main types of business ownership: • sole trader • partnerships • limited companies (private and public) • public corporations.

D2E1A4436BB9455BBF91CD33C7535920.description: Why business aims and objectives change as businesses evolve: • in response to market conditions, technology, performance, legislation, internal reasons.

CB8E9450F4874E0A97FB58D951B72E33.description: Businesses can have several objectives: • financial aims and objectives - survival, profit, sales, market share, financial security • non-financial aims and objectives - social objectives, personal satisfaction, challenge, independence and control.

3EF8092230754F488F3D879544B2A523.description: Business activity and influences on business
